caption:
This photograph depicts a lively scene of a cattle roundup in a rugged, outdoor setting. In the foreground, two cowboys, each mounted on a horse, are actively engaging with the cattle. One cowboy is on the left, reaching down to either grab or manipulate a rope, dressed in traditional western attire including a white shirt, dark jeans, a black hat, and leather gloves. His horse is dark, adorned with ornate saddle gear.

The cowboy on the right is also in traditional attire with a white shirt and hat, guiding his horse as it moves dynamically. A calf is seen running energetically in between the two horses, kicking up dust as it sprints.

In the background, there are several other cowboys and horses, scattered across the landscape, herding a large group of cattle across a wide, barren field that stretches out under a clear sky. The terrain is arid and covered in sparse vegetation, characteristic of a desert or semidesert region. In the distant background, there is a prominent hill enhancing the depth of the scene.

The photograph conveys a sense of motion and activity, characteristic of cattle herding tasks, under what appears to be bright, sunny weather conditions, contributing to the vivid and dynamic atmosphere of the roundup.
title: Spring roundup of Paiute-owned cattle begins at Sutcliffe Pyramid Lake Indian Reservation. Coralling and bRanding is done in five stages around Pyramid Lake. The calf is roped by two riders. One takes the front legs, and one the rear legs.
